Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with Europa seated on the Bull. The shoulder is decorated with a longitudinal groove; between the shoulders and the nozzle are internal volutes. The lamp stands on a flat base with an internal groove; within is an impressed palm-branch, combined with a a large iota (?). Covered with an orange-red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2037)
